dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 1839 IH: RAISE Act of 2015
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. McHenry introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Securities Act of 1933 to exempt certain transactions involving purchases by accredited investors, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Reforming Access for Investments in Startup Enterprises Act of 2015 or the RAISE Act of 2015.

subsection.text: Section 4 of the Securities Act of 1933 (15 U.S.C. 77d) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by adding at the end the following new paragraph:
transactions meeting the requirements of subsection (d).
by redesignating the second subsection (b) (relating to securities offered and sold in compliance with Rule 506 of Regulation D) as subsection (c); and
by adding at the end the following:
The transactions referred to in subsection (a)(7) are transactions where—

subparagraph.text: each purchaser is an accredited investor, as that term is defined in section 230.501(a) of title 17, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor thereto); and

if any securities sold in reliance on subsection (a)(7) are offered by means of any general solicitation or general advertising, all such sales are made through a platform available only to accredited investors.

paragraph.text: Securities sold in reliance on subsection (a)(7) shall be deemed to have been acquired in a transaction not involving any public offering.
The exemption provided by this subsection shall not be available for a transaction where the seller is—

subparagraph.text: an issuer, its subsidiaries or parent;
an underwriter acting on behalf of the issuer, its subsidiaries or parent, which receives compensation from the issuer with respect to such sale; or

paragraph.text: A transaction meeting the requirements of this subsection shall be deemed not to be a distribution for purposes of section 2(a)(11).

subsection.header: Exemption in connection with certain exempt offerings
subsection.text: Section 18(b)(4) of the Securities Act of 1933 (15 U.S.C. 77r(b)(4)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating the second subparagraph (D) and subparagraph (E) as subparagraphs (E) and (F), respectively;
in subparagraph (E), as so redesignated, by striking ; or and inserting a semicolon;
in subparagraph (F), as so redesignated, by striking the period and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:
